title: Rhapsody (1954) DVD5 Untouched - Elizabeth Taylor, Vittorio Gass
description:
Rhapsody (1954) DVD5 Untouched - Elizabeth Taylor, Vittorio Gassman [DDR]

Rhapsody is a 1954 American musical romance drama film directed by Charles Vidor and starring Elizabeth Taylor, Vittorio Gassman, John Ericson, and Louis Calhern.

    CAST:-
    Elizabeth Taylor as Louise Durant
    Vittorio Gassman as Paul Bronte
    John Ericson as James Guest
    Louis Calhern as Nicholas Durant
    Michael Chekhov as Prof. Schuman
    Barbara Bates as Effie Cahill
    Richard Hageman as Bruno FÃƒÂ¼rst
    Richard Lupino as Otto Krafft
    Celia Lovsky as Frau Sigerlist
    Stuart Whitman as Dove
    Madge Blake as Mrs. Cahill
    Jack Raine as Edmund Streller
    Birgit Nielsen as Madeleine
    Jacqueline Duval as Yvonne
    Norma Nevens as Student Pianist

Directed by Charles Vidor
Produced by Lawrence Weingarten
Written by  Ruth Goetz
Music by Johnny Green
Running time 115 minutes

MOVIE PLOT:- Rhapsody (1954)
Based on the novel Maurice Guest by Henry Handel Richardson, the film is about a wealthy and beautiful woman who follows the man she loves and hopes to marry to Zurich where he studies violin at a conservatory.
There she meets a piano student who falls madly in love with her. She must then choose between this man who loves her more than his music, and the violinist who loves his music more than anything else.
Rhapsody features music by Franz Liszt, Sergei Rachmaninov, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky, Felix Mendelssohn, and Claude Debussy.

A rich, young beauty, Louise Durant, follows the man she loves and hopes to marry to Zurich where he studies violin at the conservatory. A piano student at the conservatory falls madly in love with Louise. The violinist loves his music first and Louise second. The pianist loves Louise first and his music second. Louise must ultimately choose which man she wants.

PRODUCTION NOTES:-
The novel Maurice Guest was originally published in 1908.
Rhapsody was filmed on location in Florhofgasse, ZÃƒÂ¼rich (the street scenes) and Pontresina, Kanton GraubÃƒÂ¼nden in Switzerland.
According to MGM records the film earned $1,291,000 in the US and Canada and $2,001,000 overseas, resulting in a loss of $217,000.
